Title: N/A

reviewText: Anyone who thinks Journey can't survive without Steve Perry should think again. As the live dvd "Journey 2001" proves, the band has not lost its edged, especially thanks to lead singer Steve Augeri (who my cousin is great friends with and even wrote a song with him on the band's upcoming album - I'm not joking).In this 106 minute live show, the band blasts through all their classics - "Open Arms", "Separate Ways (Worlds Apart)", "Any Way You Want It", "Faithfully", "Who's Crying Now", "Don't Stop Believin'" and so much more! The band sounds just as good as it did 20 years ago. Anyone who blasts Steve Augeri's voice should take a second listen. I mean, he sounds exactly like Steve Perry. It's just as good! And besides, as one reviewer pointed out, Perry was a bit of jerk sometimes.This is a such a great dvd. My only wish is that they would have performed "After The Fall", "I'll Be Alright Without You" and "When You Love A Woman" but the dvd is pretty full there probably wouldn't have been enough room. This is still a great dvd.
summary: Journey "Perrylislously" Sojourns On With New Lineup.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ok let me say the basic stuff...Good picture,good sound,venue is alright,but not a great audience.Stage is not deep enough.The drummer is always too close to steve on the TV picture,because they are positioned too close on stage due to the stage size.That's not good production.To compare watch Styx 'Return to Paradise'DVD.Song selection is good,could have added some more songs.Steve augeri sounds as everyone says 'like 'Perry.Thats about it.the very fact that he sounds like Perry makes you want to compare and he doesn't stand a chance.If you are not familiar with the Journey ex-vocalist Steve Perry then You'll love Augeri.He deserves that much credit.It's a great concert and a must buy for all JOURNEY fans and even the others would like this concert which has some great tunes.Go ahead and enjoy.I loved it...But I wish another DVD with Perry also comes out.

reviewText: Deen Castronovo, new drummer for Journey, could not have been more on the money when he said the moment you hear the opening line to Seperate Ways you will think "Oh, my god...it's Steve Perry with a perm!"  Well, buy this DVD and you will not have to wait very long because Seperate Ways is the opening track and it only gets better from there!  Superior picture and awesome sound quality!  A must have for any AOR, melodic rock fan or just anyone with a superior home theatre system. - Journey For Two
summary: "...it's Steve Perry with a perm!" to quote Deen

Title: N/A

reviewText: Journey,to me,are one of the most misunderstood and underappreciated bands to come out of the progressive rock era.Fabulously talented,and so much more than the progressive pop rock phenomenon of the early 80's that they were.I must have looked at this dvd on the shelves umpteen times and passed on it after seeing that the 2 Steves were not present.I checked reviews and most were quite positive so I picked it up.The replacements,as they are referred to by the naysayers,quite simply,blew me away.I'll refer to them as full fledged new bandmembers,and their presence breathes new life into this band.Both members shine in this beautifully produced dvd concert.Dean is an excellent singer and a monster on drums,and Mr. Augeri reminded me of a young Steve Perry,with a slightly different,smokey delivery.Both are quite worthy of sharing the stage with stallworths Vallory,Cain,and Schon.Schon's playing is as good as I have ever heard.The person who complained about his guitar tone is completely out to lunch.Schon may have the best tone I have ever heard by a rock guitarist.The picture and sound quality are superb,although Steve is mixed a little low through the center channel.Steve nails these songs and makes them his own.A great disc.Long live Journey!

reviewText: Journey videos are quite scarce these days so anything captured on DVD is a major plus for us Journey fans.  The performance on this video is flawless.  Steve Augeri doesn't miss a note or a beat.  The rest of the band is as good as ever.  And in case you didn't know, they brought Ross Valory (the comic relief of the band) back.  The new face behind the drums is Deen Castranovo of Ozzy Osbourne fame among others.  His performance is stellar as well.  The overall energy of the concert is outstanding and it is captured well on this DVD.  I could have done without the lengthy guitar solo but Neal played as well as ever with all the emotion he is known for.  As for the visual side, Steve Augeri is wearing his famous red leather pants and white shirt for this show and that is visual entertainment enough really!  But Steve also runs around the stage as if he's 20, revving up the crowd and himself, and it is just a pleasure to watch.  Augeri has a great stage presence and charisma as you will see in this DVD.  The songs covered are those you would expect and would want to hear.  New songs from Arrival are present but the set list is laden with classic Journey tunes.  If you haven't seen Journey live recently, buy the DVD to re-acquaint yourself with this timeless music.  If you have seen Journey live recently, buy the DVD to relive the memories.
summary: Ah the memories ... old and new

reviewText: Journey post-Steve Perry is Journey Lite.  The new songs are simplistic, over produced and are filled with meaningless lyrics.  This disc is a reflection of that.  If you like to go to see tribute bands, and free vegas lounge acts, this disk is for you.  Shame on the guys in this band, and shame on me for being fool enough to buy this dvd.  Better to have memories of the real thing, than to have polluted my brain with Journey-Lite.  If you saw the band in the 80s, if you understand the songwriting contribution that Steve Perry brought, move on.
summary: all the joy of a canadian quarter.

reviewText: Here's the only drawback for this great concert video.  I wish that the guys would have invested more effort in the extra features.  No interviews, and very little backstage footage made me wish for more.  Then on came the show.  The first song was the powerful "Seperate Ways," and Steve Augeri immediately nailed the vocals that were originally piped by the other Steve (Perry).  Strong to the end.  Then the other "new" member, Deen Castronovo played with power and precision equal to any of the previous Journey drummer.  As well he should.  Deen played with Neil Schon on Ted Nugent's "Double Live Gonzo" as well as with many other artists including Ozzy Osbourne, Steve Vai, and with Schon and Jonathan Cain in Bad English and on their respective solo projects.  Deen is no stranger to the Journey experience! Best of all is the strong song set and video and audio clarity.  If you've experienced a live Journey show lately and as often as I have, you'll really appreciate this collection of songs!  This was one of the rare concerts where Journey played the gorgeous "All the Way," and "La Raza del Sol."This DVD is a must buy for any Journey fan or any fan of melodic, classic rock.

Una muy buena adquisicion.

reviewText: For anybody who misses Steve Perry i say get over it. He was a great vocalist but how he nearly destroyed this wonderful band is unforgivable (go to [...] for an interview with Herbie Herbert Journeys original mangaer to uncover the Truth about Steve Perry). Now onwards we go. Kudos to Steve Augeri to step in to such big shoes and to sing the songs we all know and love with such passion is unbelieveable. Deen Castronovo a great replacement for Steve Smith and he adds a new demention to the band with his vocal talent as well. As for Neal (the true heart of this band), Jonathan , and Ross what can you say about these great musicians except wow....this band since Steve Perry has left has not only grown but acutally has gotten BETTER. So heres to looking in the future with this wonderful band and to seeing them on the road for many more years to come...For the Wheel in the Sky keeps on turnin....
summary: Journey is back BETTER than EVER....

reviewText: Journey and me go waaaay back. I have loved them from the beginning and followed their career. I regret I haven't seen them live so this was a dream come true for me. I must admit from the get go that I am partial to Steve Perry (I think most of us are, right?) and I do so wish he were singing.  However, his replacement, Steve Augeri, does a good job especially on the faster songs. This is a must own for all Journey fans because Neal Schon, Ross Vallory and Johnathan Cain show that time under a true artists belt, only makes them BETTER. Great sound, wonderful enthusiasm, fantastic entertaining show to watch and enjoy many times.Soar,Soaring Heart
summary: FANTASTIC SHOW/ ALL JOURNEY FANS MUST OWN

reviewText: Back in the 79's and 80's I was more of a metalhead...Blue Oyster, Ted, Sabbath, Van Halen...and other than "Wheel In The Sky" could not stand Journey.  Well I'm a little older now and not so wise, but  I really enjoyed this dvd.  The new singer in my opinion is much better than Steve Perry.  His singing is filled with emotion and feeling; ....  Schon's guitar playing is as sharp as ever and the drummer is killer.This is a must have for any 70's & 80's nostalgia  trip even if you don't remember much of it the first time around...

reviewText: Many people can't get past the separation between Steve Perry and the rest of Journey. My suggestion to these folks is to catch the Behind The Music show that VH1 did a few years ago after Steve Augeri joined the band. The truth of the matter is, if you're a band like Journey and your biggest hits are songs like Open Arms and Faithfully, you're going to want to prewsent those songs with someone who has the vocdal range to do them justice. Steve Augeri is that singer. He even thanked Steve Perry for inspiration in the credits of the band's "13 Red" EP a couple of years back. I've always answered the critics who've said Journey isn't Journey without Mr. Perry by asking them who they'd rather hear singing those songs if Steve Perry isn't there...someone with the right range, or the ZZ Top vocalist who sang "La Grange"? Journey's drummer Deen Castronovo said it best when this concert aired on DirecTV..."People came to this show thinking, okay, guys, impress me...then when we started out with Separate Ways, their jaws dropped to the ground and they believed us after that!" This show proved to me that Journey was always Neal Schon's band from the beginning (Perry didn't join until their FOURTH album) and I've seen them five times, twice with Perry and three times with Augeri...and will go see them again anytime! This was the definitive return of this band and was truly a magical moment to see them not only come back but set the stage on fire in the process! You won't regret this if you're a REAL Journey fan.
summary: Have seen Journey many times live...they still rock!

reviewText: JOURNEY HAS HAD AND ALWAYS WILL BE A GREAT ROCK BAND THAT YOU CAN PLUG INTO YOUR CAR AND CAN'T HELP BUT SING. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS DVD FOR JOURNEY FANS EVEN THOUGH PERRY IS NOT THERE. STEVE AUGERI DOES A TREMENDOUS JOB OF RECREATING ALL THE GREAT SONGS. EVEN THOUGH TRUE JOURNEY FANS LOVE PERRY , YOU CLOSE YOUR EYES AND YOU DON'T MISS HIM.  I CAN'T GIVE THIS DVD 5 STARS BECAUSE MY BENCH MARKS CONTINUE TO BE FLEETWOODS "THE DANCE" AND THE EAGLES "HELL FREEZES OVER". HOWEVER WHAT THIS DOES SHOW IS HOW REALLY GOOD NEAL SCHON IS ON GUITAR. NEWCOMER DEEN CASTRONOVO ON DRUMS DOES A GREAT JOB AND THE OTHER ORIGINAL BAND MEMBERS OF VALORY AND CAIN ARE TERRIFIC EVEN AFTER ALL THESE YEARS BACK TO THE LATE 70'S AND EARLY 80'S. I DID NOT CARE FOR THE ADDITIONS FROM THERE NEW ALBUMA "ARRIVAL" BUT THATS JUST MY OPINION AND SHOULD NOT SWAY YOU FROM BUYING THIS DVD.  HIGHLIGHTS FOR ME ARE "SEND HER MY LOVE", "OPEN ARMS", "WHEEL IN THE SKY" WHICH BY THE WAY HAS NEVER BEEN ONE OF MY FAVORITES BUT IS WELL DONE ON THIS DVD WITH A GREAT AND DIFFERENT FINISH.  TRACKS 19/20 ARE GREAT AND TO END UP WITH "FAITHFULLY" IS ALL TOO APPROPRIATE.. BUY THIS .. YOU WON'T BE DISSAPOINTED AND GETS BETTER AS IT GOES FROM BEGINNING TO END,

reviewText: I have always been a very big Journey fan. However I did not realize there was a Journey before Steve Perry.  To me SP will always be the "voice" of Journey.  I lost touch of them in later years and didn't even realize that they had had other lead singers since him.  Since rediscovering them lately I have watched many a youtube video checking out the various lead singers.  I must admit, I really really like Steve Augeri and wish he would have been able to stick with them.  I have only had this DVD a few days and have watched it over and over and for a 54 year old woman that is saying something.  I absolutely love it.  Augeri just fits the personna I think for this group.  To bad he is no longer with them.  Buy this and enjoy, enjoy.
